#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <math.h>

#define MOD 1000000007

// Function to compute GCD
int gcd(int a, int b) {
    while (b != 0) {
        int temp = b;
        b = a % b;
        a = temp;
    }
    return a;
}

// Modular exponentiation to compute (base^exponent) mod mod
long long modPow(long long base, long long exponent, long long mod) {
    long long result = 1;
    base = base % mod;
    while (exponent > 0) {
        if (exponent % 2 == 1) {
            result = (result * base) % mod;
        }
        exponent = exponent >> 1;
        base = (base * base) % mod;
    }
    return result;
}

// Modular inverse using Fermat's little theorem
long long modInv(long long x, long long mod) {
    return modPow(x, mod - 2, mod);
}

// Function to compute the sum of digits of a number
int digitSum(int num) {
    int sum = 0;
    while (num > 0) {
        sum += num % 10;
        num /= 10;
    }
    return sum;
}

int main() {
    int N;
    scanf("%d", &N);
    int A[N];
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &A[i]);
    }

    // First part: compute ans1
    long long current_lcm = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        int a = A[i];
        int g = gcd(current_lcm, a);
        long long temp = (current_lcm * (long long)a) % MOD;
        long long inv_g = modInv(g, MOD);
        current_lcm = (temp * inv_g) % MOD;
    }

    long long modLcm = current_lcm;
    long long ans1 = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        int ai = A[i];
        long long inv_ai = modInv(ai, MOD);
        long long term = (modLcm * inv_ai) % MOD;
        ans1 = (ans1 + term) % MOD;
    }

    // Convert ans1 to string
    char ans1_str[20];
    sprintf(ans1_str, "%lld", ans1);

    // Second part: process the string
    int len = strlen(ans1_str);
    char processed_str[100]; // enough size
    int p = 0;
    // Add first character
    processed_str[p++] = ans1_str[0];
    for (int i = 1; i < len; i++) {
        char c = ans1_str[i];
        if (('a' <= c && c <= 'z')) {
            // Check previous character
            if (i > 0) {
                char prev = ans1_str[i-1];
                if (!('a' <= prev && prev <= 'z')) {
                    processed_str[p++] = ' ';
                }
            }
            processed_str[p++] = c;
        } else if (c == '.' || c == ',' || c == '!' || c == '?') {
            processed_str[p++] = c;
        }
        // else ignore
    }
    processed_str[p] = '\0';

    // Third part: parse processed_str to get N for third step
    char *end;
    long long N_third = strtol(processed_str, &end, 10);
    if (end == processed_str) { // invalid input, but assuming it's valid
        N_third = 0;
    }

    // Compute third part's answer
    int N_val = (int)N_third;
    int n;
    if (N_val % 2 == 0) {
        n = N_val / 2;
    } else {
        n = (N_val + 1) / 2;
    }
    int ans = digitSum(1) + digitSum(N_val - 1);
    for (int A_val = 1; A_val <= n; A_val++) {
        int sum_A = digitSum(A_val);
        int sum_B = digitSum(N_val - A_val);
        if (sum_A + sum_B < ans) {
            ans = sum_A + sum_B;
        }
    }
    printf("%d\n", ans);

    return 0;
}
